title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: It started with a email invite to a zoom interview. The zoom interview was mostly describing the job description and seeing if I was interested. I was also asked about 3 basic interview questions. The whole process took about 1 hour. It started with me waiting about 20 minutes for my interview started. Then I was taken back to the pharmacy room where NINE, yes NINE people were sitting in a circle around a chair where I was meant to sit. I was like “wow.” I wasn’t used to or prepared for that. Everyone had a clipboard and was making notes about me the entire time. It was a bit daunting at first. The start by introducing themselves. Who they are and how long they have been working there. Then they pick a strange question to “open” the room up and make it more causal and less stressful, and then it’s your turn. Once the prices starts, it’s not too bad. I felt it was a basic interview, except I had nine people staring at me. I think I did well, or at least as well as I could have. When it was over I was told a recruiter would contact me in 1 week because they had another interview. I’m going on week 2, so it’s safe to say I was ghosted. But it’s good to practice interviews, so it wasn’t a pointless endeavor.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell us a little about yourself. 2. Tell me of a time you felt you could have handled a situation better? 3. Why do you want to work for Novant 4. Why are you interested in this position 5.Tell me a time you were in a challenging position? -this question I stumbled on, and possibly gave a bad example. Be prepared for this one just in case. 6. What kind is most important to you in a work environment? 7.what is your ideal boss?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Wilmington, NC) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Don't waste your time and energy. I was contacted via Indeed by a Novant recruiter as a potential match for their open recruiter role. Had the initial phone screen with the recruiter, which was a great conversation, and then was quickly set up with a panel interview with three members of the Wilmington team. Interview took place on Monday and went well. I was asked all of the typical interview screening questions by each of the individuals on the zoom call. I was told I could expect to hear back from the team before the end of the week. Friday arrives with silence from BOTH recruiters I had worked with throughout the process. I reached out for feedback or next steps, even a simple "sorry we went with someone else" and am still waiting for a response. The panel interview was 2.5 weeks ago. 

As a recruiter, who has several years of experience with what goes on behind the scenes of the interview and hiring process, I get things happen, there are other candidates in process, etc. But at the very least, send your candidates the stale "thanks, but no thanks" email.  Don't just ghost them.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize tasks and stay organized?

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Jan 2022

If that telephone interview with HR goes well they will then forward your resume to the hiring manager. The hiring manager will select your resume and contact you to set up an interview if they feel like you are a good candidate to fill the position. With covid they are now doing in person interviews using zoom on your computer or phone. If the hiring manger wants to make you the job offer HR will call you and make you an offer. If you accept, HR will send you an acceptance letter and a list and directions of how to upload forms they need for onboarding. You will also sign up for an employee health physical and drug screening. After that you make an appt to get your badge made. After the background check, drug screen, forms and physical and all is good, they will tell you the friday before estimated start date time.
Interview Questions: Standard. What made you apply to this position. What are your strengths and weaknesses. Described a situation where you had to handle a disgruntled patient or family member and how you handled it and what the outcome was. Tell me about yourself.

title: Associate General Counsel Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: I went on four interviews with the legal department of this company.  The process was standard in the sense that the recruiter does a screening.  Then I interviewed with the hiring attorney, and 6 lawyers ....several of whom had 6+ years of experience less than me and did not appear to understand employment law.
Interview Questions: Questions were not well thought out and were pretty standard interview questions that most employer's ask.  You can tell the lawyers interviewing don't interview much.  Expect your routine questions you can google.   I think interviews are a chance for both parties to ask and answer questions, which I don't think these lawyers appreciated.  Things I was able to discern from the lawyers who interviewed me were that the company is very reactive, not proactive; translation = you'de be dealing with cleaning up mess from employees who are not trained on standard employment/hr policies and that don't minimize risk; the HR department is new and doesn't know much, resulting in more questions to the legal department; there are only 3 employment attorneys servicing 37,000 employees; translation - possible burnout;  the legal department specifically does not have a process in place to implement its core values, including the value of compassion and treating employees like family; the legal department lacks diversity and (most) of the lawyers were very impersonal / stiff; one lawyer stated that what she liked least about the organization was that she was always moving at lightening speed; translation = heavy work load, possibly alot of meetings, and not enough people to do the work.  Finally, 1 out of 6 lawyers mentioned work life balance, and 1 lawyer did not directly answer the question regarding how the department implements its core values.   Finally, after 4 rounds of interviews, the legal department did not have the courtesy to let me know I did not get the position.  I don't think this reflects the company's core values and shows that the department does not value other people's time.  I think this company and in particular the traditional legal departments may want to reflect as a business on the changing shifts that are occuring in business and what modern day workers are looking for in companies if they want to attract qualified candidates and increase retention rates of skilled employees.

Being a zoom interview it was difficult to hear much of the time and people often talked over each other but everyone was very polite and I would say this is a formal organization.
Interview Questions: What is the top qualification for a good business analyst.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Concord, NC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Brief, asked about experience and other details related to current position and typical questions during an interview. Interview was straightforward and concise. Did not have many questions following. Encourage to read on company and come informed and with questions
Interview Questions: What is your expectation of youre role

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application through HR. I received an email from a hiring manager for an interview. 2 managers showed up. Then I had a peer interview. 4 nurses attended.
Interview Questions: If you could change one thing about your current place of employment, what would it be and why?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multi-stage process for hiring new employees. The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making a hire.
Interview Questions: if you were a fruit what would you be

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant and relaxed. Met with hiring manager then lead psr. Took longer than expected but was very down to earth. Asked a lot of questions and went over benefits and hours etc
Interview Questions: What was a difficult work situation and how did you deal with it?

title: Guest Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Salisbury, NC) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back interview, hiring manager was very nice and down to earth. The interview was very conversational. Super sad that I didn't get the position, this seems like a great company to work for.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Terrible experience and terrible talent acquisition team, interviewed over 5 weeks ago and they dragged their feet around to make a decision. Unorganized human resources group when I asked for feedback.
Interview Questions: Recruiter experience

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview and then an in person interview. Was told I would hear back the following week for sure. If I didn’t hear back to just email. I sent two emails and they wouldn’t respond. Been three weeks and looks like sending a no is too hard to do. If you do not know someone that works here, you will not get the job.
Interview Questions: Why hire you ?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was not well planned.  Interviewer was late.  Hardly asked any questions.  NEver followed up after the interview or after phone calls.  Not good at all.  no follow up is disrespectful.
Interview Questions: "How do you do with kids?"

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone interview  within the week of applying. Interviewed with 2 people, hiring manager and a CRA. It was a little disoriented as if they didn't fully read my resume to understand my experience and background. Surprisingly, landed an in person interview a week after the phone interview and it was nerve wrecking. I interviewed with the entire team and they asked the very same questions during the phone interview. It was very redundant. The interview lasted 1.5 hrs long. A week after the in person interview I was asked for my references and got rejected 2 weeks later. They did not contact my references either so it was a bit of a disappointment.
Interview Questions: What type of clinical trials have you done?

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Manassas, VA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: You are contacted by the head RN of the office to come in for an interview.  If they offer you a position, you will receive a call from North Carolina, the headquarters (for the official offer and to discuss starting pay).  Then you go through occupational health for drug testing/labs/vaccines. Then a week long orientation for EPIC and to learn about the companies "Core Values" ....Heavy air quotes.
Interview Questions: Do you participate in drama?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Matthews, NC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward. My interview was between me and the unit manager. I was early but some how her assistant forgot about my interview. So when I got there, they weren’t expecting me. The interview was roughly 30 minutes to an hour. She later gave me a tour of the into and introduced me to other employees.
Interview Questions: Name one of your quality about yourself that requires improvement.

title: Telemetry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview with multiple attendees. After interview, observed telemetry techs in room and then brought back in to the office and asked whether the job would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this department?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: the interview process is just like any other interview at another company. There are some standard questions and then an opportunity for you to sell yourself for the position. Take advantage, do your homework, have references in your pocket, and get the job. simple.
Interview Questions: name

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Thomasville, NC) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very intense. I was asked a lot of unusual hard questions that stopped you in your tracks! So I advise one to be very prepared to go into an interview!
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was only one round for interviews. I was interviewed by 2 managers within the supply chain department. They both were very friendly and asked the standard interview questions. The interview did not last longer than 30 minutes and I was hired on the spot. Really great place for an internship and even for potential employment! Everyone in the department was nice and understanding of the fact that I was a student at the time. I never felt out of place and was always comfortable enough to ask questions and learn from them. The teams worked really well together and there was always great communication across the board throughout the department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Data Scientist Co-op Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Novant Health (Boston, MA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for this position through university job board around September 2018. Received an invitation for an interview that was to take place at Boston and not in Charlotte, NC. Interviewed at Boston in November 2019 with 3 interviewers. All 3 them were equipped to throw in both business and technical scenarios/questions. 

The interviewers were very polite and engaging which made the interview slightly less formal and more of a conversation. The interview was conducted in rounds with each interviewer spending about an hour with each candidates (there were multiple candidates when i interviewed) 

Overall experience was very good.
Interview Questions: Do you know what regular expressions (regex) is?

title: Corporate Public Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief telephone interview for the first round. The second round consisted of an in person interview followed by a writing assignment. The last round was another panel interview with a few more members of the team.
Interview Questions: What is public relations to you?

title: Psychiatric Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very laid back and comfortable. The interviewer asked questions that were common sense questions. The time frame from the day of the interview  to official call was two weeks
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was informal. I asked to shadow as part of my experience. I would recommend doing that so that you can speak with current employees and see the work environment.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Payor Credentialing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had my one on one interview with the hiring manager within a few days of applying. She was so personable and made me feel at ease. Then the next week I was asked back for a team interview...then a couple days later I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous experience?

title: Ekg Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty easy interview. The supervisor was really nice and seemed down to earth. I was not nervous and it went pretty good. Yep, pretty good. I am glad I did it.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was professional and explained all the duties and responsibilities of the position. They also showed a great deal of interest in both my professional life, but also things I do outside of the medical field.
Interview Questions: If I was a superhero, what superhero would I be and why?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Novant Health (Greensboro, NC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview with the department manager it was a interview Bliss she asked typical interview questions and spoke about the company and explained the simple life of working in that department
Interview Questions: Why would you like to be apart of the NOVANT health care team?

title: CSSO RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: It took about 1 month to get a call for an interview. Was interviewed by 2 managers. I felt like they asked me negative questions and didn't really ask about positive experiences about myself. They did read me from style questions off of a questionnaire. Was told that they are interviewing other candidates and will hear something within 2 weeks to a month.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where a patient's requests were unrealistic? How did you handle it?

title: Regional Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview/screen  with director level, in person panel style  interview with director and other regional managers.  No touch questions asked, very basic interview. Not as professional as I would have expected from a large successful healthcare organization.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Extremely thorough. Had to present in front of a panel as well as sit to interview same day. Everyone was very kind.  If you put in the work and show you’re eager, it will work in your favor
Interview Questions: What are three strengths? Why do you want to work as a trainer?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was first called and answered some quick questions over the phone that lead me to be invited to a hiring event. I picked a 30-minute time slot on the day of the event that worked for me. There were multiple tables there that were holding interviews for various positions and units. I interviewed with a director of the unit I was applying for and she asked me a few questions about myself, why I wanted to be cna, and what my availability was. She then proceded to tell me about the normal day to day activity of the unit and the work schedule. After asking a few questions of my own she thanked me and went to another table to speak with some other people. She then came back and offered me the position on the spot.
Interview Questions: Tell us of a time when you had an issue or problem with a coworker? What did you do?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Novant Health in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2 Months from Interview to Possible hiring. Just to come to tell you that they now have to abide by new HR rules and good candidates that were already selected are now not being considered. I would be careful interviewing there. Huge waste of time.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: Advanced Practice Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Thankfully their process was through the actually people I will be working for and with. I did not have to go through a recruiter for an interview. The lead clinician contacted me directly by email 2 months after I applied. Now the long and slow process of credentialing starts! Definitely worth it for the benefits and pay they offered!!
Interview Questions: What do you like about your current position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: Open house with short 5-10 minute interviews. You choose the specialty that you preferred and had an interview with nursing managers. Then you were required to have an interview with a manager for a medical surgical floor.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this specialty?

title: Nuclear Medicine Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview, then a face to face interview a few weeks later. The phone interview took place a couple weeks after applying for the position. The whole process took approximately one month.
Interview Questions: What does teamwork mean to you?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: 3 weeks to hear back for an interview. Starts with a phone interview. A week later went in for a second interview in person at the hospital. Heard back from them in a couple of weeks with the notice
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses and strengths?

title: RN Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The Management team will interview. There may be two people in the room during the interview. You will stay in the interview room until two peers come in to interview you. The peers are there to see if you will be a good fit for the group and you will be able to ask peer interviewers about the position so you can see what a typical day will consistent of and you can ask them questions about what they like/love about the job and/or coworkers. There is a brief tour of work environment.
Interview Questions: What is something that has or is frustrating about your current/former job and how did you handle it?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Novant Health (Durham, NC) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy and it was mostly about how you deal with problems you encounter. They want to know about your problem solving skills. As long as you know how to deal with people, you will be just fine.
Interview Questions: What is a difficult situation you encountered and how did you deal with it

title: Patient Services Coordinator IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was extremely informative about the position and she was pleasant. She didn't ask the standard questions that most hiring managers ask. She focused on what the position entailed.  She also introduced me to the 2 providers that are in need of a patient services coordinator.
Interview Questions: Are you able to run an entire front desk on your own?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview with a panel of a healthcare team. The position was described in great detail, and there were lots of scenario questions were asked. I Was told that I would be called in a couple of weeks, was never contacted. No letter or email of declination either.
Interview Questions: What skills can you have to bring to this company?

title: Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions:
1 interview through a recruiter, a phone interview with a Novant Higher up, and an onsite interview. 

The onsite interview was with someone else that I wouldn't be working for, due to the other person being on military leave.
Interview Questions: What do you like about the role

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interviewed directly with the hiring manager.  We discussed salary ( of course, they always want to know that right up 
front ) my experience and skill set.  He was enthusiastically agreeing that the position was a great fit for me.  I felt confident, based on his responses and fully expected to hear back from HR on the next step in the process - the manager assured me he would get with them with a compensation package range the very next day.  That was months ago.  I have sent two emails following up and I still hear crickets. No response!  Nothing - not even get lost! I am certain they have proceeded with another candidate, but why not just say so?  It seems to me, today's corporate world is full of ill-mannnered,  boorish, disrespectful children who mislead, misrepresent and have lost the professional ability to treat candidates like people.
Interview Questions: What my salary requirements were

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: There is an initial application period followed by a phone interview then an onsite interview. The phone interview was only 25 minutes and was with the current fellows. Overall the interview seemed easy, but the competition was steep.
Interview Questions: Biggest accomplishment?

title: Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Greensboro, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two senior staff members. Both asked questions. Email or call will say if employment is offered. After background check, drug test, and immunization have been verified you will then have orientation with the company. Following that will be orientation with your department.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard. Interviewed with three different people in the room. Was comfortable, everyone was very nice, and were able to answer any questions I may have about the unit and facility practices.
Interview Questions: General question information: Describe a situation you handled well in your experience, some negative stuff you had to deal with, covered the standard questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied to several positions that I qualified for, online. The HR representative contacted me, asked me several easy preference questions, then offered to setup interviews for me. The first group that I interviewed with (a group of 4 from one unit) made me feel really comfortable and asked very valid questions pertaining to the acuity of the unit. One nurse manager from the unit called me hours after the interview and told me they had chosen me for the position. HR contacted me the very next day with an offer, we negotiated, I accepted the offer. I was extremely impressed.
Interview Questions: Strengths. What is your typical day at work for you like now. How would you handle this PR issue...

title: X-ray Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was short and the interviewer was not able to tell me much about salary since HR normally does this.  Manager was very nice and seems pleasant to work with.  HR called weeks later and offered me the position
Interview Questions: They asked about my Xray experience

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone call asking if i was sitll interested a week later had a relaxed interview, she asked me to tell her about myself and then asked the basic "tell me about a time questions", got an email saying i was offered the position and the starting salary, then 2 weeks later have a background check and drug test and  2 weeks after that have orientation
Interview Questions: tell me about a time you went above and beyond what was required of you

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Novant Health (Kernersville, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The whole interviewing process is lengthy. I interviewed with the office I was hired at two times. Near the very end of the interview the manager told me to stay close to my phone. About two weeks later I received a call from Novant Health Talent Acquisitions​ offering me the job. From the first interview to the job offer it was about four months.
Interview Questions: Can you multitask or do you only focus on one thing at a time?

title: Account Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very descriptive about  job opportunities and what was expected of job applying for.  The benefits were layed out in great detail as well as expectations.  Possible to get promotions once hired
Interview Questions: What was I looking for in a new career opportunity?

title: Registered Medical Assistant In A Non-hospital Practice Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward.  Interviewer was polite, friendly, and the staff was very pleasant.  It made me comfortable to picture myself on the team.   When I called to follow up, the staff was again friendly and professional, the practice manager that I had interviewed with was wonderful.  They called for a second interview with the physicians the following week.  The physicians were delightful and really made me want to work for them.  It was a very positive experience and put me at ease from the very beginning of the process.
Interview Questions: Tell me what a normal day was with your previous employer

title: Psychiatric Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very scattered, unorganized, I had to wait for 45 minutes for the main nurse, got tour however, confused if I am getting job. Very annoyed. Was given business card. Was asked questions by multiple people, was there for over 2 hours however, told when I come back what elevator to use and that they were excited for me. still unsure whether I got the job.
Interview Questions: Why psych?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Manassas, VA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: They called me in for an interview with the Clinical Admin. I met with the hiring manager and discussed the position. I also discussed what was being asked for in the position.
Interview Questions: Past Work Experience

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Novant Health (Myrtle Beach, SC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was professional and it was concise. We talked about procedures and policies.  After that was a tour through the hospital to meet some of the staff.  I  think it was a good interview.  Things could not have been better
Interview Questions: They didn't they just said that we would be doing respiratory therapy treatments and patient care.  They looked at my experience and asked about equipment and procedures.

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Manassas, VA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from HR in regards to my application. We then set up an interview with the unit supervisor. Went in for the interview and received an email from HR about 1-2 weeks later that I got the job.
Interview Questions: What made me apply for this job.  What kind of experience did I have.  Give an example of a personal time when a patient was irate. How did I handle a team member in the past where you did not agree on something

title: CSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Muskogee, OK) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: it was very simple and they asked basic interview questions. They also give scenario questions and ask a time when you went above and beyond in the workplace. blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place with multiple pharmacists. The questions were not too difficult and the atmosphere of the pharmacy department was pleasant. Definitely seems like a good company to work for.
Interview Questions: What experience do I have?

title: Mulitple Positions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Apply on line, there is an option to create your own account to review the status of your applications.  Does not really explain anything, just states if it is in review status, declined, withdrawn.
Interview Questions: Where do you want to be in 5 years, the basic interview questions that really give a vague insight to the person you are

title: Research Clinical Data Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with preliminary online questionaire. All done through online and text. Very lengthy and at end after hired was asked to pay for my equipment and software with " understanding" that I would be reimbursed. Refused job and reported as a possible scam.
Interview Questions: About my work ethic

title: End User Computing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Manassas, VA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
When scheduling the interview I was provided an address, but they neglected to mention that it wasn't in the main building.  I called my contact from the lobby of the hospital and he told me to drive to another building in the back.

Pretty basic interview.  Very few technical questions and everyone was very friendly.  At the end of the interview I was told that they had one more person to interview and they would let me know in about a week.  I called the hiring manager 10 days later because I hadn't heard back.  He sounded very irritated and told me they were still interviewing.  I never heard anything after that and took another offer.  I was also irritated that the job posting said Manassas, but in the interview he said the position would be in Haymarket.
Interview Questions: Q: What is a thin client?

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions:
It is very hard to get an interview if you are an external or even an internal candidate that works in a different department. You basically have to know someone who can get your resume to the hiring manager since HR doesn't do a very good job of identifying the right candidates. 

The interview questions themselves are a list of about 20-30 situational questions produced by HR and I've found that most hiring managers do not stray from those, which I find odd since those questions are generic and do not specifically address the questions you may need to ask a potential employee to assess if they have the skills necessary for the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to come in for my interview, as well as directions to get to the unit. Once I arrived for the interview, it was a panel setting with 1 CNA, 3 nurses, the the night shift supervisor.
Interview Questions: What are three things you could work on about yourself?

title: Staffing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Novant Health in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview was conducted with a panel of 3. The manager spoke about the position and aloud me to talk about my background. One panel member spoke about what they do on a daily basis, but was interrupted by the manager to tell me they are looking to fill position fairly quickly and if I have any questions to call the number back or the HR dept. I was not given the chance to ask any questions. Manager cut it short and it seem like they were trying to meet their interview quota for the position.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your background?, 
I was not able to ask any questions

title: Physical Therapy Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The application and hiring process was simple and quick. The one tricky part is that each company refers to this position as a different title. The interview for this position was rather informal, short, and about what I expected. The rehab supervisor at the time was phenomenal and very friendly, which is what made this interview such a good experience for me.
Interview Questions: What personal skills or traits would make you a good member of our team?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with the nurse manager of the unit.  Sat and talked with nurse manager one on one in the office. I was offered beverages and made to feel comfortable.  After an hour plus of talking, I was given a tour of the unit.  Very comfortable atmosphere and welcoming staff.
Interview Questions: History of schooling, experience in previous jobs, why I wanted to apply for the position.  Nurse manager shared with what the company has to offer it's employees.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied and received a call from the hiring manager 1 week later. I went to the interview and it went really well but the next day saw that the online site stated "not accepted." This was a glitch in the website but I did get an offer that I accepted. Interview was pretty standard and the hiring manager was great but HR takes a while to respond.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult patient/coworker.

title: Pharmacy Technician CPhT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: It took nearly 4 months to be hired.  The interview process was very unpolished and unprepared. 1 telephone interview and 2 in person interviews. After not hearing from them for a month I called and was told they were glad I called because they forgot to call me!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Novant?

title: Administration Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by an employee of Novant, I had my interview and it went awesome. He explained the job to me and asked if it was something I would be interested in doing.
Interview Questions: I was asked how comfortable I was with people

Was asked about myself. My current position was asked in detail. She asked about my team and how we worked together. Also told me of the gentlemen who left and how he fit very well in the group.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Assistant Vice President of Pharmacy Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was relaxed and positive.  I spoke with the recruiter several times over the phone, then set up a formal interview.  We had a very good back and forth during our conversations. I was able to ask the questions I had prepared, and the Novant rep was able to do the same.  Overall I thought the interview went very well.
Interview Questions: What were my expectations of this position

title: Patient Services Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Novant Health (Huntersville, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I applied in December 2015 got a phone interview then was set up for a face to face interview in Jan  then another interview for mid Jan I didn't hear from them until mid February 2016 they have very poor communication skills they took forever to answer my emails and calls. I wouldn't want to work in a place that.
Interview Questions: What do you know about novant?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Novant Health in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was good. I applied on 4/15 and sent a email on 4/22 to set up interview. I interviewed on 4/25 with the Director. Was very comfortable with interviewer and she was very extremely knowledgeable of company which is what I liked. Was told I may be scheduled for second round interviews in a week or so. Fingers crossed, as I believed the Director was impressed with me. I have not been made an offer yet, which is why I selected the No Offer tab for now. I will update once I hear something.
Interview Questions: Looking back on the past, name one person who you wanted to grow up to be like and why, including one person you didn't want to be like and why.

title: Medical Office Assistant/Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Novant Health (Louisburg, NC)
Interview Descriptions: one on one with manager of the clinic, introducing to doctors and staff, wanted  tell you about job your applying for, ask why should we hire you, telling me about there company what there requirements and what they expect of the position I'm applying for, discuss salary, hour time of work, 8 am- 5 pm they explain how you might not getting off work sometimes at work, discuss taking a drug test and back ground check talking with some of the doctors you will be working with
Interview Questions: tell them alittle about yourself

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC)
