title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was extremely nice and was very friendly. Overall the interview was laid back with typical interview questions. Nothing that was unexpected. She also gave me a tour of the unit. Most questions were based on background and how past experiences will help you with the current position being applied for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in healthcare?

title: PSC III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview went very well as expected.I was early for the Interview and this was helpful to the Office  Team Manager. I was in and out within 30 minutes. The office environment was welcoming and I'm glad i choose Novant Health to work for.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was called to set up a interview day and time, went in was told about the position what I would be doing, they looked over my resume and stated I was more then qualified and they would reach out to me the following week, the gave me a tour around the unit, and the following week I received a e-mail stating I was hired for the position
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for Novant?

title: CMA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Lexington, NC) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty long, even thought I had worked for the company before, they asked a lot of generic questions, and I think the hold up in my starting date was HR. The orientation was long and boring.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years with the company?

title: Patient Service Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The overall interview process was positive. The staff was friendly. I enjoyed the overall atmosphere of the office. Office manager as well as the office coordinator made me feel comfortable during the interview process.
Interview Questions: What stands you apart from the other applicants?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I got a call a few weeks (thinking it was two weeks) later to set up an interview. The interview was what I expected and the person interviewing me really made me feel like she was very interested me. She was very pleasant and welcoming to help me feel relaxed, so I could be myself during the interview.
Interview Questions: So explain to me what it takes to plan an event?

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: They use pure behavior questions that seem to differ from person to person. Be prepared with detailed examples of real experiences that you can apply in their environment. Smart people that see through fake answers. Be genuine.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time you had disruptive trainees how did you handle it?

title: Physician, Family Practice Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Group interview over lunch with people coming and going. Disorganized.  Random questions led by 2 VPs, without about 15 people in the room listening,  No individual interviews with a variety of people.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this job?

title: Practice Manager III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Good interview
I applied for the job online on August 12, 2015. I received a email on August, 29 to schedule a interview on September 2nd.
I Met with the Regional Manager first and it was an awesome interview.
Three days later I met with the VP and it was another great interview.
One week later I met with three Physicians and Im still waiting on an offer
Interview Questions: Do you have budgeting experience?

title: Medical Unit Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the job online through novant on 8/10 and received a call to interview 2-2.5 weeks later. The interview was very laid back compared to previous interviews. I interviewed with the head nurse/manager and another nurse in the L/D dept. The interview last approx. 30-40 minutes. They both asked me a total of 10 or so questions. The following day I sent my thank you email.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Adjunct Professor Anatomy and Physiology Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: I was assessed by other professionals including the the academic adviser to demonstrate my teaching skills. I did show and lectured on the EKG. With a view that I was delivering to students. asking questions and answering questions as the interview went on I was considered legible for the position and I was employed.
Interview Questions: previous experiences I have encountered. What i would do with difficult students that includes slow learners or trouble shooters.

title: PAS/ED Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: It was truly a very difficult and trying process... there isn't much more I can add to this at this particular juncture.  The process was one which needs much preparation both physically and mentally not to mention emotionally.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Trauma Response Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was welcoming, panel of peers and supervisors, comfortable. I was put at ease with warm personalities. I really wanted it to go well and was a bit nervous, but they eased me into questions and got to know who I am. I also got a look into each person's uniqueness and leadership styles.
Interview Questions: Who would be your priority patient in  pregnant trauma situation?

title: Tier I Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Novant Health (Indian Land, SC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The managers were really pleasant and fun to talk with; they really wanted the personality and skills.  It was more on being able to work as a team with different backgrounds and methods to solve or at least have the ability to directed the issue to the correct department.
Interview Questions: Do I get stressed easily?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The same questions are asked at every interview when trying to switch within the company. Basically they want to know why you want to move within the company. They have a list of preprinted questions they will ask you. They vary between supervisor and managers being in the same interview to save time. More often than not, it is a behavioral interview.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last position.

title: Safety Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: go in and talk with a Nursing Supervisor, they ask a couple of behavioral interview questions, and ask a lot of questions to get to know you, if they show you around the hospital after the interview you basically got the job
Interview Questions: was there a time where you dealt with a upset customer, how did you handle them?

title: Cna1plus Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Novant Health (Salisbury, NC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Up to 8 people to interview you in a closed office and review the floor after. Meeting the employees and get to talk to them about the hospital.  Then you get a second interview talking about salary and getting the job offered to you
Interview Questions: What do you love about the cna position

title: Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Novant Health (Kannapolis, NC) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: questions as to wanting to know if you are a quick learner and able to jump in to do referrals once being trained. what  made you want to transition to this position and will you want to transfer back to the bedside?
Interview Questions: experience that you have and what experience do you have in referrals and how familiar are you with the referrals process?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Novant Health in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: My initial contact during the interview process was by email. After emailing for a while, a phone interview was set up. We mainly discussed my background and I spoke to only one person. Then another phone interview was arranged, this time with a group of people. The third and final interview was in-person. Each interview lasted approximately 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? Where do you see yourself in 5 years? On a scale of 1-10, how interested are you in this position?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant and professional atmosphere and welcoming interviewers.  I met with over 15 employees, approximately 3-5 at a time for around 30 minutes each.  They asked tough, but relevant questions and explained the duties of the position in great detail.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a confrontation without immediate access to a supervisor or manager?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Novant Health (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I discussed my experience and the needs of the organization with Rev Cycle training manager and current HIM ID for ROI.  They asked about my experience with Epic materials and the Credentialed training process which I have a great deal of experience with.  I understand that I would work on the upgrade lessons, training CT and preparing for training end users while the new HIM ID would attend Epic classes and complete her certification.  This worked out well because I was able to help her prepare for her HIM ID role while learning more about Novant Health.
Interview Questions: How would you handle users who need extra help.

title: Patient Service Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: A Novant health practice Coordinator contacted me by telephone to request an in person interview. I was contacted approximately five business days after I completed an online application for this position. An in person interview wad scheduled within three business days and a follow up interview with another management team nine days later.
Interview Questions: why I chose Novant  health. More specifically why I chose that practice and it's specialty.

title: Patient Services Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied to Novant Health online and within a week received a phone call from the clinic that had the opening.  I was asked if i could go in that same day.  The interview went well, I was asked the basic questions.  "where do you see yourself in 5 years?" "what appeals to you about this positions?"  etc.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: After applying was approximately  2 months before called to interview. After the interview however, recieved an offer within the week. Was unable to start right away because corporate orientation only 2 times a month. A little disorganized with computer training class. Sent to the wrong  location twice. And  training in a different location everyday.
Interview Questions: What strengths will you bring to our organization

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Salisbury, NC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Asked me basic interview questions. Then I was asked to provide relatable experiences in my life. The hiring manager stated that she was drawn to my personality so she selected me to be a part of the Float Pool.
Interview Questions: When was a time that you experienced with a difficult co-workers

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Novant Health in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took about a month from the time I applied to when I received a call back.  Once I received the call from the hiring manager, I had an interview right away, which was easy.  I received an offer three days later.
Interview Questions: Scheduling

title: Patient Services Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Huntersville, NC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I've actually interviewed with this company 5 times, and the interviews are not too bad. Usually you meet with the Manager first, and then peer interview to follow with 2-4 peers. Just frustrated and sad that I can't get an offer after 5 interviews and 132 applications submitted. I've been told I interview well and I'm qualified for the positions I apply for down to a tee. Feels like a waste of time, sometimes.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a co-worker that is not easy to get along with?

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Took a while for the manager to get back to you.  Process went smoothly afterwards.  I had a phone and a skype interview.  I met with the team the first day on the job.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to relocate

title: Pcs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went on line and applied got a call the next day for the interview process. Went in for interview and had to wait 20 minutes they did apologize for the wait. Interview process was fairly easy and they made me fill at ease. Never got a call back
Interview Questions: Have you ever put quanity before quality

title: Secretary/NA I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Salisbury, NC) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed for a Secretary/NA I position in Critical Care, but during my interview was asked if I would rather interview for a position in Behavioral Health. They scheduled an interview the next day where I met with the Clinical Nurse Lead for the unit.

The interview consisted of questions that were mainly testing my crisis management skills, ability to work through issues that may arise in the work place, and why I wanted to work with the company.
Interview Questions: What skills have you gained from you experience?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions:
Two months after I applied for a position, I was called by a recruiter to do an initial phone interview.  The recruiter forgot our appointment, I had to call her after waiting 15 minutes after our scheduled time.  During the phone interview it was obvious the recruiter was doing something else besides engaging in a conversation.  An good example, I stated I supervised 21 people, she interrupted and asked me if I had supervisory experience.  Obviously someone was not listening at all!

Two weeks later I got an email about scheduling a second interview in person.  I responded to the recruiter’s email about my availability.  It has been two weeks since I have heard back from the recruiter and a week past when the interviews were supposed to be held. If the company chose not invite me to a second interview, that is fine, but have some courtesy and let a candidate know instead of leaving them dangling.
Interview Questions: The most difficult issue I had with the interview was the person conducting the interview.  I was less than impressed with her ability to communicate effectively, not to mention her lack of professionalism.

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Haymarket, VA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Received a phone call from the hiring manager within one week.  Had 2 telephone interviews and asked me to come in for face to face interview.   I could not do the face to face interview on the managers chosen day, she promised to call back with alternate dates.  She left one message and never returned any of my calls.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult people.

title: Nurse Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: Once your application had been screened by recruiters in Human Resources it is forwarded to the hiring manager who then contracts you for an interview. Your offer for employment comes from the HR Department and they also conduct salary negotiations.
Interview Questions: I began my tenure with the organization in an entry-level, non-clinical role. During my interview fir the Nursing position I currently hold, I was asked, " What did you learn on that first job that you can apply to this role?" I thought that was an excellent question.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was an HR intern for six months and the Supervisor gave a lot of behavioral questions-such as give me an example of a time when you impressed a customer with your service? Another question was give me an example of a time when you handled an angry customer. The interview had 2 phases: one interview with the Manager of Talent Acquisition and one with a recruiter. Overall, it was an easy interview. The team was very warm and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time when had to break the rules in order to achieve a goal.

title: CNAI Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: After applying a million times I finally got a call to do an interview. I went in and the only questions I was asked were why did I want to work at novant and what did I do at my last job. We never even went into much detail with either, the nurse basically started a conversation with me about how they were revamping the hospital and how she was trying to get her staff on board and how she had to fire some folks to make way for ones with better attitudes.  Then we went on a tour. She let me know her expectations for her staff and i thought she was the kind of person i would like. Im glad she didnt ask me too many questions anyway, i can always do without the stress. After that I had to go to hr and do a background check. Once it was completed I got the offer. Im assuming that by as many applications I have sent there in my whole life, which I would estimate upwards 1000,  the fact that I only got one call means they probably already knew they wanted to hire me. I didnt know anyone in novant so ive never been able to get a hookup in getting on even though I have been a cna for 11 years and a steady employment history and pretty good resume. I think someone had mercy on me and actually looked at my application for what it was without being told to by someone internally. Thank goodness, finally.  I have heard this practice happens in most hospitals.  You have to know someone to get on!
Interview Questions: why do you want to work at novant

title: Central Scheduling Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty cut and dry it was all of the supervisors interviewing me.  They asked me questions like why do you want to leave your current job and what kind of relevant experience do you have for the positon.  They gave me a tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short. This was for an entry level position, therefore I didn't go through various rounds of interviews which would have happened if I were applying for a clinical position or a position that required more experience.
Interview Questions: What is it your looking to accomplish by working here?

title: Operational Improvement Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was good.  HR processes were poor, they did not understand that people from outside healthcare had different benefits.  PTO was poorly explained (I had no idea that holidays were not paid, but covered under PTO, relocation package was laughable, and I was not treated as a professional in the offer process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got called for an interview. Was interviewed by a peer panel, was told to let me know next week, but was never called or heard from ever again.
Interview Questions: All questions were basic, kinda what you expect during any other interview. None were difficult.

title: Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a waiting game. But once the interview was scheduled it moved smoothly. I sat down in a panel style interview and the directors were extremely nice and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Tell us of a time you had to go against the norm and eventually have a process changed?

title: Safety Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Novant Health (Bolivia, NC) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just basic behavioral questions, mostly ethical type questions. A few can be: tell me about a time you failed & how you handled it, tell me about your proudest achievement, you make a serious mistake on the job -- what do you do to rectify the situation?
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you failed and how you handled it

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was an internal hire. So, I'm sure It's different. I applied, talked to the talked with the manager and landed an interview after getting referrals. First round was the manager and fellow coworker; I had second round of interview with the P.I. and afterwards got hired.
Interview Questions: name a time where you had to deal with a  difficult boss or coworker. how did you handle it.

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Long process took over 5 months to be contacted for interview after application was recieved
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Haymarket, VA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: When you get called in for an interview, you are interviewed by all the department's managers. I was interviewed by about 5 different people. It may not be so many since a lot of them left for other opportunities...They all will take turns asking you interview questions. Then they call you about 2 weeks later to offer you the job and let you know when orientation starts. The training is about 1 month or more I don't really recall. But it's EXTENSIVE.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to deal with a difficult patient?

title: Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is lengthy.  You may have more than one interview and the second interview is likely to be a peer interview with several staff members.  The screening process is very thorough which is good.  Once an offer of employment is made, you will be scheduled for a urine drug screen and then scheduled for your first day in orientation.  The initial orientation is about 2 days depending on your job.
Interview Questions: I always have a tough time answering the question:  Why should we hire you?  Or, what are your strengths and what are your weaknesses?

title: Sec/Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Novant Health in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I thought the interview went well. I was offered the same salary that I had been making however a year later my salary was cut 10% because although my duties were added on to in some areas they were decreased in one other. At times I did not feel as though the person was listening to me as an individual but instead just a run of the mill warm body to fill a spot. I have excellent references and work ethics and am proud of them.
Interview Questions: I did not feel that I was asked a question too difficult. I felt very prepared for interview.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The 'job fair' was like speed-dating; you had just a few minutes to grab a nurse-manager's attention and get them to invite you back for an 'in-depth' 15-minute interview later in the day.  The nurse-managers/units that chose to be involved were at tables in a large room; the 100-odd candidates scattered & stood in line to give our pitch to our chosen units.  We had about 45 minutes to talk to as many as possible.
Interview Questions: There wasn't really time for them to ask questions.

title: Allied Health Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very rushed, was told I had the job in the first 5 minutes of the interview. Manager was very personable, but could tell she was overwhelmed by department, duties, etc. Was in an office that I could tell need severe updates.
Interview Questions: What opportunities are you expecting to attain within your first year, if hired?

title: Phlebotomist/Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Huntersville, NC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Manager is fair and equitable. He always brings peers in to get their input and also expects demonstration of skills.
Interview Questions: Where do you expect do be in three years?

title: Materials Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Manassas, VA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Went great! Everyone was very nice and friendly. Did not "scare" me away. Questions that were asked we not hard at all. I received a tour of the hospital during my first visit. During my second interview I received another tour and meet the rest of the employees in the department.
Interview Questions: Why did I choose this type of job?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was with Director of Ops and Special Ops rep. Reviewed my qualifications and overall job requirements and responsibilities. Never mentioned the issues with the provider and that I would be the 5th manager in less than 2 years- this definitely would have been a red flag for me to RUN as fast a a could from accepting the position if offered.
Interview Questions: Very interested in my knowledge if the corporation as I lived in Greensboro and the main offices were located in Winston Salem. I was glad I did my research prior to the interview.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC)
Interview Descriptions: slow, took forever for them to get act together
Interview Questions: none, they wanted me, just could not get their stuff together

title: REG NURSE Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Novant Health (Matthews, NC) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: very nice experience no computers, it was face to face.It did take several weeks and many phone calls later to get an interview. back the there were not computers you did everything by paper and fax machines. I was lucky that I had a friend that worked there and she helpped me get my foot in the door and get an interview with the charge nurse in the OR.
Interview Questions: they asked about my extensive OR expirence

title: Coding Education/Auditing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Brief, talked about barriers, fairly new department. Sat with VP and newly hired manager to discuss job ideas . Process was frustrating overall, however pay was good. I was not impressed with the interview, staff seemed desperate to fill positions.
Interview Questions: How would I handle a difficult trainee?

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Manassas, VA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview Went Smoothly as expected. they asked mainly about patient care and first response in an emergency situation . ask about mainly the task at hand.
Interview Questions: How Would You Deal With Diversity.

title: Radiology Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and informative. A good process that had a clear job description and did not waste time. The supervisor took me on a tour of the facility, I met other employees, and observed the workplace. I learned a lot and was able to easily transfer positions within the company.
Interview Questions: Describe an area where I had a conflict with a co worker and how did I handle it.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Not a good one, people were rude, quick to judge, did not list to answers.  They were wanting to get out as soon as possible and some did leave.
Interview Questions: How many children do you have, how old are they, are you married, where did you go to school

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: It went quick.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was very short.   I was an employee referral.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Patient Registration Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Manassas, VA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions:
2 phone interviews.  In person interview with 5 interviewers (2 of which would have worked for me).  Panel interview lasted closed to 90 minutes

After the panel interview I was instructed to go to a different building to take a couple of tests.  (behavioral, trustworthiness etc.)  That was another 2 hours of time.

I received a call the next day and was asked if I could return.  When I asked about a time frame, the interviewer asked why I would care how long it took.  I explained that the 5 hour interview the day before left me wondering what else could possibly be required.  Needless to say, we parted ways at that point.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my desired salary while in the interview with 2 subordinates.  I recall saying, "I am happy to discuss a salary commensurate with my experience should an offer be intended," The panel insisted on a salary and I was really thrown off-guard by that when considering 2 of my staff would know my salary

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Novant Health in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with HR. Typical interview, typical questions, engaging interviewer and easy to talk to - know the company and its mission before walking in. Be prepared for behavioral questions and answers and be able to specifically defend resume with valid real life examples and numbers.  Second interview with hiring manager, did not say but a few words as she talked the entire time. She had canned questions, on a form she created, asked questions and wrote down answers on sheet. Easy second interview.
Interview Questions: By hiring manager, not HR - "how do you cook a hot dog?"

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Novant Health (Charlotte, NC) in Oct 2008
Interview Descriptions: Completed application online, was sent generic response the a call came to set up a time to come in and take a test. After that was called a few days later for an interview with the recruiter, then a second interview was scheduled with the managers - 5 at once.  Said they would contact me if interested in hiring..call came a few more days later with an offer.
Interview Questions: Nothing unusual, just a bit nervous interviewing with 5 managers at once.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Novant Health (Winston-Salem, NC) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: They called for interview, I went. Interview went well, they said they'd be in touch in a couple of days. They said I had the job. 3 weeks went by, nothing. I talked to a nurse friend of mine that worked there and she asked them why they hadn't hired me. They said I had withdrawn my application. I finally did get the job tho.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?
